I wonder is there a proper way to make an exploding part detonate adjacent ones...

Well, I 'overheat' a target part with a kind of laser beam; the part then explodes -- but generally does not harm neighboring ones. Fiddling with explositionPotential variable yielded nothing; so I ended up iterating through adjacent parts (see Physics.OverlapSphere) and manually blasting those ones that were too close.

Does someone have a better idea on how to implement that?
Well I have seen if you place MANY over heating parts near each other they all explode and everything around also explodes.

Well I have seen if you place MANY over heating parts near each other they all explode and everything around also explodes.
Yes, that\'s exactly what I\'m trying to achieve... with affecting a single part)))

So I wonder is there a way to greatly increase a single explosion\'s power.
I don\'t know the right configuration for a good explosion but if someone knows, reconfigurate the part in the frame it reaches MaxTemp so it will blow up in the next one...

Maybe if you make the maxtemp of a object super high it will absorb lots of energy and go boom, most likely not. =P
